metadata.title: CVE-2021-39636 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In do_ipt_get_ctl and do_ipt_set_ctl of ip_tables.c, there is a possibleway to leak kernel information due to uninitialized data. This could leadto local information disclosure with system execution privileges needed.User interaction is not needed for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions:Android kernelAndroid ID: A-120612905References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-39636` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic - 4.15.0-24.26
linux-image-4.15.0-24-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-24.26
linux-image-4.15.0-24-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26
linux-image-4.15.0-24-snapdragon - 4.15.0-24.26

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-24.26').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-37.41~18.04.1').
